frameDefinitions: An Agent acts so as to be the strongest force, or most important causal factor in some Situation, to the exclusion of other competing actors.
An Agent, by virtue of strength or forcefulness, controls, rules, or strongly influences some Patient in some Situation.
This frame is concerned with Cognizers remembering and forgetting mental Content.
This frame is only for words that are used as the Titles of individuals.
A Controlling_entity has control of a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity  or group (the Governed) or an Activity.
frameExamples: York <t>dominated</t> the game as they held the ball on offense almost the entire 70 minutes.
The fireballing righthander looked poised to <t>dominate</t> the Yankees yet again, striking out seven straight batters during one stretch
He saluted <t>General</t> Fightmeister walking into the room.
She was in <t>control</t> of the empire within two days.
Sebek em hat was a <t>Leader</t> of Priests. ca. 1780 BC
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the most forceful and pivotal factor in the situation.
The <fen>Situation</fen> is primarily affected by the <fen>Agent</fen>, in particular how it develops or concludes.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> is dominant.
The location where the domination takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> controls the Patient by being forceful and possibly aggressive.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is trying to gain control of a situation, but ends up being subject to the control and influence of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time when the domination takes place.
The place where the domination occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose mental <fen>Content</fen> is at issue.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the mental content that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> retains or forgets.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject the <fen>Cognizer</fen> mental <fen>Content</fen> is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the remembering or forgetting of mental <fen>Content</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the remembering or forgetting takes place.
The name of the person referred to by a <fen>Title</fen>.
How a person is referred to within an Institution, often denoting their rank or status. Title is always marked on the target.
A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> effects the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.

The <fen>Leader</fen> is the one who has the role of leading.  With verbs, and with predicate nominals linking an individual to a <fen>Role</fen>, the <fen>Leader</fen> is usually the External Argument:

The role played by the <fen>Leader</fen> in a given situation, often an official title; incorporated in most noun LUsin this frame. When expressed separately from the target, <fen>Role</fen> usually occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>as</ment>.
The entity whose actions or beliefs the <fen>Leader</fen> directs in the context of a joint activity or movement.  This entity can be a political body, a person, or a group of people.
The <fen>Leader</fen> directs the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> refers to the point in time that the leadership took place.
The locale from which the <fen>Leader</fen> leads the <fen>Governed</fen> or the <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: As discussed above, Ford dominated the market <fex>in the 1920s</fex>, then left the business to create production capacity for the Model A.
Indeed, <fex>in all Latin America</fex>, United States corporations dominated the key sectors of the economy.
Their role models might have dominated women <fex>in the past</fex>; they may not have understood the concept of equality.
Women tend to dominatemen <fex>at home and at Church</fex>.
Each student must be able to recall <fex>the whole paragraph</fex>  .
Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to control <fex>playback speed</fex>.
The general led his troops into battle <fex>on June 22, 1883</fex>.
He ruled the west <fex>from his palace in Milan</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP)
Southern Politics in State and Nation
the Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals
